For me, this game kind of fills the gap that Evolve left behind, in that one player is the monster while 4 others have to survive. To sum this game up, it's pretty much a game of cat and mouse except the mice have to fix generators and the cat likes to hang people on hooks.


Oh and then a giant spidery cthulu monster eats their souls.

I nominated this game in 'Labor of love' 2019.

游戏是非常不错的，无论是画面还是配音都做到了让玩家心惊胆颤的感觉。玩法也很有创意，是4V1的鼻祖，但是就是主机问题特别烦，每次只能连在屠夫的电脑上，导致延迟很严重，屠夫一拔线全退。游戏进入时BUG也很多，常常导致出不来，但我已经玩了860小时，觉得这游戏就是玩不腻，只是找房间比较费时而已。可以推介。
its fun

I've been a long time follower of this game. I finally got it just before Myers was released. I'll start by saying I've enjoyed it for what it's worth, but the developers are blatant idiots. This is a 4v1 game and they clearly cater to survivors. None of the developers are actually good at the game, so they balance the game around low rank survivors.

Not only do they do this, they nerf killers around high rank statistics. Make that make since. The Nurse was the almighty killer at rank 1, but everywhere else, outside of high ranks, she was very bad. Why? She had the highest skill ceiling and needed countless hours to master. The devs stated her kill rate isn't insane at high ranks and STILL nerfed her because survivors kept either DC or complaing.

They do not listen to anything regarding killers. They hold PTB just to ignore all the feedback from killers. They killed the original Freddy one week after his release, they killed Legion, they nerfed ghostface one week later, Nurse was nerfed, and now Spirit is next. When will it end!?

I've left the game. I was a former R1 Hillbilly player and we all know he's next. The mods on the forums ban anyone questioning Dev decisions. They even do the same on steam forums. Until there is a true competitor to this game, it'll either kill itself due to idiot devs or simply have 0 viable killers to stop SWF.

I hope anyone reading this heeds my advice. This game isn't worth it anymore.
El Juego es bueno, pero me banearon por que se les dio la gana :c

Buenisimo!

Really great game! I'm surprised by how taken I am by the experience. It's multiplayer, but not too competitive. It has lots of little random elements and surprises so it also stays fresh. Playing both sides also changes the game and adds to the replay value. The dev team is also constantly working on the game and trying to balance it well. 

All of the DLCS though makes the game expensive, although it's possible to buy most characters with in-game earned currency. However for an older gamer like me that started 2 years after release, the grinding for all the abilities and perks is harsh.

xq si

I've played this game quite a bit, and I've witnessed first hand the decline this game has gone through. What was originally a fun horror-themed game, over time, has become for one half of the gameplay almost boring from success rates while the other half has become an exercise in patience for the people still crazy enough to play it.


Survivors have consistently been given more and more control over the flow of the match, while the killer side struggles now to even get two kills in many cases due to the abuse of mechanics and bugs in the game by survivors, which killers are oft unable to do much about preemptively. There are only three killers that can reliably stop the dreaded "pallet loop", which happen to be the two trap based killers, Trapper and Hag, plus the Huntress, one of the few killers with a ranged attack. The others are unable to avoid being subjected to this overused at best and overpowered at worst strategy to waste time for the killer. 


Another killer used to be able to reduce pallets to a non-issue, until BHVR neutered her into worthlessness. The killer in question is the Nurse. Once a high skill killer with great potential for the skilled player, has now become near useless due to her ability being stuck in cooldown hell AND being subjected to pallet stuns on top of it. BHVR is no doubt looking to do something similar to another killer which, at this time, is "overperforming", known as the Spirit. Due to the constant fucking over of the killer side of the gameplay, killer queues have plummeted and getting a survivor game can take anywhere from 5-15 minutes. Until BHVR fixes the killer gameplay, you cannot reasonably expect to pay for this game, the DLCs of your choice, and get your money's worth.
